DOC.brief_title: Dissemination Cervical Cancer Screening Primary Care Physicians Underserved Communities
DOC.detailed_description: The specific aim proposal : 1 . To test hypothesis intervention , multi-component academic detailing , increase rate physician cervical cancer screen 3- 6-months post-randomization , compare rate observe service-as-usual control . 2 . To develop model predict physician office least likely adopt intervention , generate hypothesis tailor dissemination cervical cancer screen guideline different physician subgroup . 3 . To conduct cost-effectiveness analysis compare incremental societal cost effect ( life save , life-years save , quality-of-life-years save ) cervical cancer intervention implement physician ' office . The long-term goal project therefore reduce cervical cancer risk among ethnic racial minority , influence screen behavior primary care physician .
